doc: Provides a space-separated list of strings to be used as geometry names. This overwrites the names imported from molecular structures file.

The pathname of a file defining the initial coordinates of the chemical object. This file is meant to be amond the input of comp.chem. software packages that do not allow to define the coordinated in the input file defining type and configuration of the molecular modeling task (e.g., XTB).
The definition of the job for which we are going to generate the input file/s.
Defines the charge of the chemical system/s given as input.
Defines the spin multiplicity of the chemical system/s given as input.
Prevents the specification the charge of the system, if possible. This is often used when inheriting the charge information from a previous job.
Prevents the specification the spin multiplicity of the system, if possible. This is often used when inheriting the spin multiplicity information from a previous job.

Defines the format to use for writing Cartesian coordinates (e.g., '%10.8f'). The string must follow the syntax defined by the official formatted printing for the Java language syntax. See documentation of java.util.Formatter.

Defines the format to use for writing internal coordinates (e.g., '%4.4f'). The string must follow the syntax defined by the official formatted printing for the Java language syntax. See documentation of java.util.Formatter.

tag: the importing of chemical objects (e.g., molecular geometries)
the writing of the input for a job
